result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda C Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment ONLY.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim:  Jessica H.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Complete 20 hours of Community Service.
*Letter of apology.
*Anger management.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge,  by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
filed, Count 1:  Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to sec. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats.  a Class A Misdemeanor.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amanda C Porter in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Amanda C Porter in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 02.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
